question_text: Which two scenarios pose a serious safety risk during PSU disassembly? (Select two)
answer_options: Unplugging the PSU before opening it
Touching components near the power MOSFETs
Measuring AC input with the power supply plugged in
Leaving the PSU grounded during testing
correct_answer: Measuring AC input with the power supply plugged in
explanation: PSU internals can store lethal charges, and live AC input should never be probed without proper insulation and training.
